hackathon-description-text: Sign-in at the Heights Lounge (515 West 185th Street, New York, NY 10033).  On arrival you will get your name badge and some free swag!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Young Professionals Advisor, Nefesh B'Nefesh & Founder, TAMID@YU
Advisory Committee, US Homeland Security & CompSci Dept. Chair, YU Stern College

hackathon-eligibility:
You must attend the hackathon in person to be eligible.
Projects have to be started at the hackathon (not before registration).
Maximum of 5 persons per team.
Participants ages 16-25 are welcome.
hackathon-rules:
By participating or being in attendance at this event, you agree to these rules. These rules apply through the entire event. They may be changed at any time by hackathon officials. 
All participants are expected to follow Yeshiva University's ("YU") Code of Conduct. This Code covers topics including, but not limited to, integrity, vandalism, theft, harassment, and the use/possession/distribution of drugs and alcohol. 
YU will not give any team resources needed to complete their project, nor will costs for materials or other expenses (including travel) be reimbursed. 
Projects must not be identified as an official product of YU.
Participants are expected to respect YU's property and others, including cleaning up after themselves and promptly reporting damage to hackathon officials. 
Projects that pose a safety risk will not be allowed, including hazardous materials and anything that produces a spark or flame. You will be working on the idea in an enclosed space. 
For your safety, security will be on site for the event. They may check bags or other items, and reserve the right to ask any individual to leave the premises. 
Intellectual property for the projects submitted will remain with the creators of said projects. YU will only use any code, artwork, or other assets submitted for the purpose of fair and equal judging. Submissions are stored on ChallengePost and not on YU data servers.
Hackathon officials may disqualify any team from the competition for violations of these rules or any other behavior deemed inappropriate for the event.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive. Each winning team member will get the Watch Dogs® 2 Collector's Edition game.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team with the best domain name registered on Domain.com/MLH wins an awesome Domain.com swag pack for each team member!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Domain Name Registered with Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell 1TB Hard Drive for the best hack utilizing Amazon Web Services

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=515 W 185th St, New York, NY 10033, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How complex is your project? How functional is your project? Did you integrate multiple devices / API’s?
How awesome does it look and how natural does using it feel?
How well can you convince the judges that your hack is the best?

hackathon-location-address: 515 W 185th St, New York, NY 10033, USA
